org.epochx.ge.op.init
Class FixedLengthInitialiser

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.op.ConfigOperator<GEModel>
      org.epochx.ge.op.init.FixedLengthInitialiser
All Implemented Interfaces:
GEInitialiser, ConfigListener, Listener, Initialiser, Operator
public class FixedLengthInitialiser
extends ConfigOperator<GEModel>
implements GEInitialiser

Initialisation implementation which constructs each program's chromosome to a specified length with a random sequence of codons. All programs generated with this initialiser will have the same length of chromosome. Each codon is generated with the CodonGenerator.

If a model is provided then the following parameters are loaded upon every configure event:

  • population size
  • codon generator

If the getModel method returns null then no model is set and whatever static parameters have been set as parameters to the constructor or using the standard accessor methods will be used. If any compulsory parameters remain unset when the initialiser is requested to generate new programs, then an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

See Also:
FullInitialiser, GrowInitialiser, RampedHalfAndHalfInitialiser

FixedLengthInitialiser

public FixedLengthInitialiser(GEModel model,
                              int chromosomeLength)
Constructs a FixedLengthInitialiser with the necessary parameters loaded from the given model. The parameters are reloaded on configure events. Duplicate programs are allowed in the populations that are constructed.

Parameters:
model - the GEModel instance from which the necessary parameters should be loaded.
chromosomeLength - The initial length that chromosomes should be generated to.

onConfigure

Specified by:
onConfigure in interface ConfigListener
Overrides:
onConfigure in class ConfigOperator<GEModel>

getInitialPopulation

public java.util.List<CandidateProgram> getInitialPopulation()
Generates a population of new CandidatePrograms constructed by generating their chromosomes with the codon generator to the currently set chromosome length. The size of the population will be equal to the population size attribute. All programs in the population are only guarenteed to be unique (as defined by the equals method on GECandidateProgram) if the isDuplicatesEnabled method returns true.

Specified by:
getInitialPopulation in interface GEInitialiser
Specified by:
getInitialPopulation in interface Initialiser
Returns:
A List of newly generated CandidatePrograms which will form the initial population for a GE run.

getInitialProgram

public GECandidateProgram getInitialProgram()
Constructs a new GECandidateProgram with a chromosome of length that matches the chromosome length property of this initialiser. Each codon will be generated with the currently set CodonGenerator.

Returns:
a new GECandidateProgram instance.

getChromosomeLength

public int getChromosomeLength()
Returns the length of chromosome that all new GECandidateProgram instances will be generated with.

Returns:
the fixed length that this initialiser is generating chromosomes to.

public void setChromosomeLength(int chromosomeLength)

Parameters:
chromosomeLength - the fixed length to use for the chromosomes of generated programs.

isDuplicatesEnabled

public boolean isDuplicatesEnabled()
Returns whether or not duplicates are currently accepted or rejected from generated populations.

Returns:
true if duplicates are currently accepted in any populations generated by the getInitialPopulation method and false otherwise

setDuplicatesEnabled

public void setDuplicatesEnabled(boolean acceptDuplicates)
Sets whether duplicates should be allowed in the populations that are generated, or if they should be discarded.

Parameters:
acceptDuplicates - whether duplicates should be accepted in the populations that are constructed.

getPopSize

the size of the populations that this initialiser will generate.

setPopSize

public void setPopSize(int popSize)
Sets the size of the populations that this initialiser should construct on calls to the getInitialPopulation method.

Parameters:
popSize - the size of the populations that should be created by this initialiser.

getCodonGenerator

public CodonGenerator getCodonGenerator()
Returns the codon generator that this initialiser is using to provide new codons for each candidate program that is constructed.

Returns:
the codonGenerator the CodonGenerator that is providing each new codon.

setCodonGenerator

public void setCodonGenerator(CodonGenerator codonGenerator)
Sets the codon generator that this initialiser should use to obtain new codons for newly constructed candidate programs.

Parameters:
codonGenerator - the codonGenerator to use in generating new codons for the new candidate programs.
